response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Arts News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment?cmp=rss en-ca Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:35:17 EST CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Hedley allegations put spotlight on music industry in wake of #MeToo]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/hedley-allegations-music-industry-1.4541231?cmp=rss 1.4541231 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:35:17 EST The Canadian Press News/Entertainment

Allegations of sexual misconduct swirling around pop-rockers Hedley have put the spotlight on an industry long defined by the mantra of sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll — but several music veterans believe a powerful change is already well underway.

]]> <![CDATA[Kate Winslet, Emma Watson among those supporting U.K. version of Time's Up]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/times-up-british-stars-1.4541161?cmp=rss 1.4541161 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 09:50:39 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Almost 200 British female entertainment stars called for an international movement to end sexual misconduct across society in a letter published ahead of Sunday's British Academy Film Awards.

]]> <![CDATA[Roger Deakins wins cinematography award for Blade Runner 2049]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/deakins-wins-blade-runner-1.4541196?cmp=rss 1.4541196 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 10:48:12 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Roger Deakins may be inching closer to making good on his 14th Oscar nomination after winning the American Society of Cinematographers' feature film award for Blade Runner 2049.

]]> <![CDATA[Weinstein Co. fires chief operating officer David Glasser]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/weinstein-company-david-glasser-fired-1.4540906?cmp=rss 1.4540906 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 18:16:10 EST Reuters News/Entertainment

The board of the Weinstein Company has dismissed the beleaguered film studio's president and chief operating officer, less than a week after he was cited for failing to act on employee harassment complaints.

]]> <![CDATA['I can watch it again and again': Black Panther evokes pride across Africa]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/black-panther-opens-africa-1.4540610?cmp=rss 1.4540610 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 11:17:52 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Black Panther has burst onto the screen in Africa, handing a powerful response to the unfortunate remarks about the continent by President Donald Trump.

]]> <![CDATA[Vince Gill defends Grammys on female representation]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/vince-gill-defends-grammys-1.4540747?cmp=rss 1.4540747 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:16:16 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Vince Gill defended the Recording Academy over the criticism that female artists were underrepresented at this year's Grammy Awards.

]]> <![CDATA[Aisling Walsh wins Irish best director award for Maudie]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/aisling-walsh-wins-irish-best-director-award-for-maudie-1.4540638?cmp=rss 1.4540638 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 11:53:45 EST The Canadian Press News/Canada/Nova Scotia

Irish-Canadian director Aisling Walsh has won the award for Best Director at the 2018 Irish Film and Television Academy Awards ceremony in Dublin.

]]> <![CDATA[Jimmy Kimmel blasts Donald Trump, Congress for Florida school shooting]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/kimmel-gun-control-florida-1.4540599?cmp=rss 1.4540599 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 10:34:34 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Jimmy Kimmel opened his late night show by urging U.S. President Donald Trump and Congress to make stronger gun control laws.

]]> <![CDATA[Hedley fans at concert standing by their band despite allegations]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/brandon-hedley-concert-allegations-1.4540242?cmp=rss 1.4540242 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 21:57:37 EST CBC News News/Canada/Manitoba

Sexual misconduct allegations swirling around Canadian pop band Hedley didn't prevent many Manitoba fans from heading to see the band perform live in Brandon on Friday night.

]]> <![CDATA[Miami giveaways were for Drake's new God's Plan video]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/drake-gods-plan-video-1.4539434?cmp=rss 1.4539434 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:10:38 EST CBC News News/Canada/Toronto

It was one oversized cheque after another as Drake shot his new video for God's Plan in Miami last week, and now we know why.

]]> <![CDATA[Soulpepper loses $375K of planned federal funding in wake of sexual harassment scandal]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/soulpepper-federal-funding-rescinded-1.4539129?cmp=rss 1.4539129 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 14:12:22 EST CBC News News/Canada/Toronto

A planned increase in federal funding for Soulpepper Theatre has been voted down by the Canada Council for the Arts’ board of directors.

]]> <![CDATA['Controlled mayhem': Mr. T talks about his love of curling on As It Happens]]> http://www.cbc.ca/radio/asithappens/as-it-happens-friday-edition-1.4538952/controlled-mayhem-mr-t-talks-about-his-love-of-curling-on-as-it-happens-1.4539621?cmp=rss 1.4539621 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:58:28 EST CBC Radio Radio/As It Happens

Curling has a new ambassador - Mr. T. Ever since the start of the Winter Olympics he's been glued to the sport - and has been tweeting feverishly about his newfound love.

]]> <![CDATA[Exploring power and privilege: why Black Panther is a hero for our time]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/black-panther-review-1.4532316?cmp=rss 1.4532316 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:04:40 EST Eli Glasner News/Entertainment

Director Ryan Coogler's Black Panther may borrow a few moves from other superhero movies, but the film's vibrant influences and exploration of complex ideas set it apart.

]]> <![CDATA[Transparent star Jeffrey Tambor out of series, Amazon says]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/tambor-transparent-amazon-1.4538535?cmp=rss 1.4538535 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 09:11:04 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Amazon Studios says Transparent star Jeffrey Tambor won't be on the series when it returns for its fifth season, prompting the Emmy winner to denounce what he called false accusations and the studio's handling of the matter.

]]> <![CDATA[Hedley dropped by management, but some fans still back the band]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/hedley-management-dropped-fans-support-1.4538782?cmp=rss 1.4538782 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 11:44:10 EST CBC News News/Entertainment

Hedley has been dropped by its management team, even as many fans maintain their support for the pop-rock group despite allegations of sexual misconduct.

]]> <![CDATA[This museum's phone has been ringing off the hook thanks to Justin Bieber]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/london/stratford-ontario-justin-bieber-museum-exhibit-1.4537622?cmp=rss 1.4537622 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:47:56 EST Colin Butler News/Canada/London

It's not every day that a local history museum can say its phone has been ringing off the hook, but lately the calls don't stop coming at the Stratford Perth Museum.

]]> <![CDATA[Actors Jennifer Aniston, Justin Theroux announce separation]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/aniston-theroux-separation-1.4538220?cmp=rss 1.4538220 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 21:29:25 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux decided to separate late last year, but the actors say the split was amicable, according to a statement released Thursday.

]]> <![CDATA[In the cast, with a cast: Students reschedule Footloose after lead actor breaks leg]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/footloose-odonel-high-students-leg-break-hepditch-1.4538500?cmp=rss 1.4538500 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 10:03:55 EST Geoff Bartlett News/Canada/NL

When Andrew Hepditch broke his leg a week before opening night, he thought the musical was over. But the Mount Pearl show will go on.

]]> <![CDATA[Corus Radio suspends airplay of Hedley in wake of sexual misconduct allegations]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/hedley-off-radio-corus-1.4537850?cmp=rss 1.4537850 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:17:59 EST The Canadian Press News/Entertainment

Corus Radio has suspended all airplay of Hedley songs across its 30 music stations as the Canadian rockers face allegations of sexual misconduct.

]]> <![CDATA[Yannick Nézet-Séguin fast-tracked as Met Opera's new music director]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/nezet-seguin-met-early-1.4536852?cmp=rss 1.4536852 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:46:19 EST The Associated Press News/Entertainment

Yannick Nézet-Séguin will become the Metropolitan Opera's music director next season, two years earlier than planned, providing a leader to an orchestra fighting drift and defections for more than a decade.

]]>
